name: Dandelion Chips
author: Shanda
summary: Forget kale chips! Dandelion chips are plentiful, crispy, and yummy - and you can just pick them in your yard! Make sure they have not been treated with pesticides though.
directions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
Combine olive oil, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl
Add leaves and toss until well combined
Lay the leaves in a single layer on the prepared baking sheets and drizzle with remaining olive oil mixture
Bake in the preheated oven until dandelion chips are crisp, making sure they do not burn, 12 to 16 minutes
Leaves will stiffen as they cool
